title: Building the Ignition Libraries documentation does not mention that gcc8 is required

content.raw:
Following the documentation in https://ignitionrobotics.org/docs/acropolis/install#building-the-ignition-libraries, on Ubuntu 18.04 the compilation fails with the following error:
~~~
straversaro@iiticublap103:~/src/ignition-workspace$ colcon build
Starting >>> ignition-cmake2
Starting >>> ignition-tools
Finished <<< ignition-tools [0.25s]                                     
[Processing: ignition-cmake2]                                 
Finished <<< ignition-cmake2 [45.7s]                          
Starting >>> ignition-math6
Finished <<< ignition-math6 [6.34s]                        
Starting >>> ignition-common3
Starting >>> ignition-msgs3
Starting >>> sdformat8
--- stderr: sdformat8                                                     
CMake Error at cmake/DefaultCFlags.cmake:67 (message):
  sdformat8 requires g++ 8.0 or greater.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:177 (include)
---
~~~

It is probably necessary to document that GCC8 should be used instead for compiling Ignition  Acropolis.
